elements.description:
A component that retrieves the current weather information for a given location from The Weather Channel (TWC) using the TWC API. Weather observations are generated on demand from The Weather Channel Currents On Demand system. The return observation object contains weather data such as temperatures, winds, and pressure.
Note: The Weather Channel API requires a license and is constrained by the API Key entitlements. To use this component, update the TRIRIGAWEB.properties file and set The Weather Channel API license key in the WEATHER_API_KEY property.
Example of requesting the current weather conditions for postal code 30075 in the United States. Example of requesting the current weather conditions for a location specified by latitude and longitude. Example of displaying the current temperature and a phrase that describes the weather conditions.
{{observationCurrent.imperial.temp}} Fahrenheit
{{observationCurrent.phrase_32char}}
### Units of measurement The Weather Channel API supports the following units of measurement: e = English units, m = Metric units, and h = Hybrid units (UK). Example of requesting the current weather conditions with Metric units. The return observation includes temperatures in Celsius. ### Translation The Weather Channel API handles the translation of phrases. A valid language must be passed along the request. Example of requesting the current weather conditions with the Spanish language. The return observation has phrases in Spanish. As mentioned above, the return observation object includes many properties that describe the weather conditions. It also includes icon information such as icon codes and their associated weather phrases. See The Weather Channel API documentation for more details about the current weather information and usage.

properties.name: auto
properties.description: If location is provided, automatically request the weather conditions for this location.

properties.name: baseUrl
properties.description: URL to The Weather Channel API.

properties.name: _apiKey
properties.description: The Weather Channel API license key. The license key will be loaded from Tririga web properties file (WEATHER_API_KEY property).

properties.name: language
properties.description:
The requested language. The Weather Channel API supports the translation of phrases based on the requested language.
For example, The Weather Channel API returns the phrase "Cloudy" for English en-US and "Nublado" for Spanish es-ES.
See The Weather Channel API documentation for valid languages.

properties.name: units
properties.description:
The unit of measure for the response. The following values are supported: e = English units, m = Metric units, and h = Hybrid units (UK).
For temperatures in Celsius, use Metric unites, and for temperatures in Fahrenheit, use English units.
See The Weather Channel API documentation for valid units of measurement.

properties.name: postalAndCountryCode
properties.description:
String that represents a location based on postal code and country code.
Format {postal code}:{country code}.
Supported country postal codes: US (United States), GB (United Kingdom), FR (France), DE (Germany) , IT (Italy).
For example, 89178:US.
See The Weather Channel API documentation for valid country codes.

properties.name: latAndLong
properties.description:
String that represents a location based on geocode.
Format {latitude}:{longitude}.
For example, 36.0671730:-115.1616650.

properties.name: observation
properties.description:
The return current weather observation object. It contains weather data such as temperatures, winds, and pressure.
See The Weather Channel API documentation for details about the current weather information.

methods.name: _getWeatherAPIKeyFromServer
methods.description: Retrieves The Weather Channel API license key from the server (property WEATHER_API_KEY).

methods.name: getWeatherAPIKey
methods.description: Return The Weather Channel API license key that was retrieved from the server (property WEATHER_API_KEY).

methods.name: initForPostalCode
methods.description: Automatically requests the weather information when auto flag is set to true and a postal code and country are provided.

methods.name: initForLatAndLong
methods.description: Automatically requests the weather information when auto flag is set to true and a geocode is provided.

methods.name: getBaseWeatherUrl
methods.description:
Return base weather URL for The Weather Company API.
The API supports requests by postal code or by geocode (latitude and longitude).

methods.name: _getPostalUrl
methods.description:
Return the postal code URL. For example location/30075:4:US.
The postal code of The Weather Company has a proprietary location type (4) with the following
format: location/<postal code>:<location type>:<country code>

methods.name: _getGeocodeUrl
methods.description:
Return the geocode URL (latitude and longitude). For example, /geocode/34.063/-84.217. 
Format: /geocode/<Latitude>/<Longitude>

methods.name: generateRequest
methods.description:
Request current weather information from The Weather Channel API.
The API supports requests by postal code or by geocode (latitude and longitude).

methods.name: _onResponse
methods.description: On response, set the current forecast provided by the weather API.

events.name: triplat-weather-apikey-update
events.description: Fired after retrieving The Weather Channel API license key from the server (property WEATHER_API_KEY).

events.name: triplat-weather-generate-request
events.description: Fired a request to get the weather conditions automatically when auto flag is set and a location is provided.

events.name: triplat-weather-current-response-complete
events.description: Fired when a response from The Weather Channel API is completed.

events.name: triplat-weather-current-response-error
events.description: Fired when a response from The Weather Channel API fails.

elements.description:
A component that retrieves the forecasted weather information for a given location from The Weather Channel (TWC) using the TWC API. Weather forecasts are generated from The Weather Channel Forecast system. The return forecasts object contains weather data such as temperatures, winds, and pressure.
Caution: This component was upgraded to Polymer 3, but was not fully tested. Please use this component with caution.
Note: The Weather Channel API requires a license and is constrained by the API Key entitlements. To use this component, update TRIRIGAWEB.properties file and set The Weather Channel API license key in the WEATHER_API_KEY property.
Example of requesting 10 days of forecasted weather data. When the API path is not specified, the default is 10 days. The return forecasts object contains an array of forecasted data. If the date property is set and it is within the 10-day range, the forecast object will contain the forecast of that day. Example of using the forecasted weather data.
[[forecast.night.phrase_32char]]
High: [[forecast.max_temp]] Fahrenheit
Low: [[forecast.min_temp]] Fahrenheit
Example of requesting 5 days of forecasted weather data. If your API key is authorized for only the 10-day forecast, and you attempt to request a 5-day forecast, you will get an error stating that "API not allowed for this API key." ### Units of measurement The Weather Channel API supports the following units of measurement: e = English units, m = Metric units, and h = Hybrid units (UK). Example of requesting the forecasted weather conditions with Metric units. The return forecasts object includes temperatures in Celsius. ### Translation The Weather Channel API handles the translation of phrases. A valid language must be passed along the request. Example of requesting the forecasted weather conditions with the Spanish language. The return forecasts object includes phrases in Spanish. As mentioned above, the return forecasts object includes many properties that describe the weather conditions. It also includes icon information such as icon codes and their associated weather phrases. See The Weather Channel API documentation for more details about the forecasted weather information and usage.

properties.name: auto
properties.description: If location is provided, automatically request the weather conditions for this location.

properties.name: baseUrl
properties.description: URL to The Weather Channel API.

properties.name: apiPath
properties.description:
Path to The Weather Channel API. The default API path requests 10 days of weather forecasts.
See The Weather Channel API documentation for valid forecast API paths.

properties.name: _apiKey
properties.description: The Weather Channel API license key. The license key will be loaded from Tririga web properties file (WEATHER_API_KEY property).

properties.name: language
properties.description:
The requested language. The Weather Channel API supports the translation of phrases based on the requested language.
For example, The Weather Channel API returns the phrase "Cloudy" for English en-US and "Nublado" for Spanish es-ES.
See The Weather Channel API documentation for valid languages.

properties.name: units
properties.description:
The unit of measure for the response. The following values are supported: e = English units, m = Metric units, and h = Hybrid units (UK).
For temperatures in Celsius, use Metric unites, and for temperatures in Fahrenheit, use English units.
See The Weather Channel API documentation for valid units of measurement.

properties.name: postalAndCountryCode
properties.description:
String that represents a location based on postal code and country code.
Format {postal code}:{country code}.
Supported country postal codes: US (United States), GB (United Kingdom), FR (France), DE (Germany) , IT (Italy).
For example, 89178:US.
See The Weather Channel API documentation for valid country codes.

properties.name: latAndLong
properties.description:
String that represents a location based on geocode.
Format {latitude}:{longitude}.
For example, 36.0671730:-115.1616650.

properties.name: date
properties.description: The date for the forecast object. If the date is not within the range of the forecasts object then the forecast object will be null.

properties.name: forecast
properties.description: The return forecast weather object for the specified date property. It contains weather data such as temperatures, winds, and pressure.

properties.name: forecasts
properties.description:
The return forecasts weather object . It contains an array of forecasted data, each with many properties. The data values in this API are populated
into Day, Night, or 24-hour segments. If the date property is set and it is within the 10-day range, the forecast object will contain the forecast of that day.
See The Weather Channel API documentation for details about the forecasted weather information.

methods.name: _getWeatherAPIKeyFromServer
methods.description: Retrieves The Weather Channel API license key from the server (property WEATHER_API_KEY).

methods.name: getWeatherAPIKey
methods.description: Return The Weather Channel API license key that was retrieved from the server (property WEATHER_API_KEY).

methods.name: initForPostalCode
methods.description: Automatically requests the weather information when auto flag is set to true and a postal code and country are provided.

methods.name: initForLatAndLong
methods.description: Automatically requests the weather information when auto flag is set to true and a geocode is provided.

methods.name: getBaseWeatherUrl
methods.description:
Return base weather URL for The Weather Company API.
The API supports requests by postal code or by geocode (latitude and longitude).

methods.name: _getPostalUrl
methods.description:
Return the postal code URL. For example location/30075:4:US.
The postal code of The Weather Company has a proprietary location type (4) with the following
format: location/<postal code>:<location type>:<country code>

methods.name: _getGeocodeUrl
methods.description:
Return the geocode URL (latitude and longitude). For example, /geocode/34.063/-84.217. 
Format: /geocode/<Latitude>/<Longitude>

methods.name: generateRequest
methods.description:
Request forecased weather information from The Weather Channel API.
The API supports requests by postal code or by geocode (latitude and longitude).

methods.name: _onResponse
methods.description:
On response, set the days forecast provided by the weather API.
If the forecasts object includes the given date, then set forecast property with weather data for that date.
